reviews.text: The Suicide Squad feels like the twilight of the age of superhero movies, making way for a new form of megablockbuster to exchange places.
reviews.author: Joshua Polanski

reviews.text: Gunn’s script, while never as clever as it believes itself to be, is rarely dull. It might not linger in the mind the way it wants to, but there’s no denying that The Suicide Squad represents a step in a better direction.
reviews.author: Joonatan Itkonen

reviews.text: It is a deeply political and culturally critical movie about the state of the world without ruining the fun. The movie plays with the callousness and dispensability of life sacrificed for the US government’s policies, which are not idealized
reviews.author: Sarah Vincent

reviews.text: Gunn kept audiences on their toes with action that could have been ripped from the comic books, humor that was sharp and landed hit after hit, and still a surprising amount of heart that made it easy to cheer on these mischievous characters.
reviews.author: Amy Smith

reviews.text: Gunn’s fans can dig into The Suicide Squad and its rejuvenation of the DC Universe — even if the movie, like its director, is more committed to a good time than a long time.
reviews.author: Aditya Mani Jha

reviews.text: ... funny, gory, energetic, and marvelously absurdist. What else would you expect from 'Guardians of the Galaxy' director James Gunn?
reviews.author: Sean Axmaker

reviews.text: Imagine Tarantino directed an R-rated version of the live-action Scooby-Doo film with a CGI shark and you get The Suicide Squad.
reviews.author: Jillian Chilingerian

reviews.text: EVERYTHING I WANTED & MORE! It’s hilarious, entertaining, surprisingly emotional but brutal/bloody at the same time! James Gunn not just crafted one of my favorite comic book movies once again, he created a flat out Creative WACKY EXPERIENCE
reviews.author: Zach Pope

reviews.text: The phenomenal cast elevates the overall picture with fantastic performances all-around, though Daniela Melchior's breakthrough performance is an absolute standout. James Gunn just can't seem to miss.
reviews.author: Manuel São Bento

reviews.text: The material is bonkers enough to let Gunn play with stereotypes, employ fresh visuals, and use this versatile cast to deliver crazy sequences that go overboard on purpose.
reviews.author: Akos Peterbencze

reviews.text: Cascading with carnage, The Suicide Squad is shamelessly silly and savage while tapping into gruesome imagination.
reviews.author: Annie Banks

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad isn’t a subtle film, in its violence, or its themes. There is a lot to unpack with this film regarding the American prison system, American Interventionalism, and what it means to keep the peace.
reviews.author: Benjamin Wiebe

reviews.text: If you are looking for a film that improves on every misstep that its predecessors made, The Suicide Squad is that film. You will laugh, you will wince, you will aww, you may even cry, as you are sucked into the magic of a rated-R James Gunn film.
reviews.author: Adrian Ruiz

reviews.text: Everything I'd hoped it would be: it was funny, shocking, violent — it was everything you'd want in a movie about expendable supervillains, and so unlike anything else we've seen in the genre.
reviews.author: Jonathan Garcia

reviews.text: It isn’t that you don’t believe the people in the film, but that the situations are so outlandish, they could have only originated on the comic page and that alone should be worth the price of admission.
reviews.author: Wesley Lovell

reviews.text: "There is so little that is new or surprising in this genre, that it takes true innovation to get anywhere close to the inventiness that makes these films truly sing."
reviews.author: Cate Young

reviews.text: Ferociously funny and devilishly cool.
reviews.author: M.N. Miller

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is the most fun you’ll have at the movies all summer, as James Gunn serves up a gloriously gory and gut-busting superhero spectacle.
reviews.author: Zoë Rose Bryant

reviews.text: Even with its flaws, the film has this uniquely raucous and chaotic pulse and once you get in sync with it you can’t help but have a good time.
reviews.author: Keith Garlington

reviews.text: A bad reheated dish simply prepared to consume before it expires... [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Erick Estrada

reviews.text: "I actually really enjoyed the film. I audibly laughed out loud a few times. John Cena is hilarious in this film as Peacemaker, he actually has some of the best one liners of the film."
reviews.author: Kay-B

reviews.text: James Gunn not only provides a hilarious and unique superhero tale, but also brings a surprising understand and empathy to those who are often cast as villains in a world that never allows them to be seen as anything else.
reviews.author: Jessie Gender

reviews.text: THE SUICIDE SQUAD sticks to its love for dark-humored, splatter b-movie schlock so much, that it almost becomes a detriment. But the whole thing is just too different and crazy to not somehow endear the film and its strange characters.
reviews.author: Jimmy Cage

reviews.text: Nothing would prepare me for the high-octane, love letter to the genre that would be James Gunns The Suicide Squad. A film that is more than a blockbuster, its cinema at its grandest and most pleasing.
reviews.author: David Gonzalez

reviews.text: It's hard to see Gunn's first DC adventure as anything other than successful. A chaotic joy, The Suicide Squad doesn't have much of a point to make - most superhero films try to build a universe, this one blows it to smithereens.
reviews.author: Victoria Luxford

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad isn't a horrible movie. It's just not a terribly memorable one.
reviews.author: Lissete Lanuza Sáenz

reviews.text: With The Suicide Squad, James Gunn blends his earlier sensibilities into a pitch-perfect summation of his work to this point.
reviews.author: Brian Eggert

reviews.text: Gunn's smart-aleck supervillain team adventure is a labor of twisted love bursting with genuinely funny sick jokes and sicker characters (Polka-Dot Man shoots out lethal polka dots).
reviews.author: John Beifuss

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad feels like a rare treat, something to be treasured and something worthy of the big screen experience.
reviews.author: Maria Lattila

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad gives James Gunn big-budget carte blanche to deliver his unhinged vision for the titular cabal of anti-heroes, and the result is one of the most thrillingly unrestrained comic book movies ever made.
reviews.author: Shaun Munro

reviews.text: Funny when it needs to be, heartfelt when it wants to be, and just gloriously fit for purpose.
reviews.author: Grant Watson

reviews.text: James Gunn's The Suicide Squad represents a considerable improvement over David Ayer's disastrous 2016 film, infusing exciting action, great characters, and lots of humor into a highly entertaining flick.
reviews.author: Jeff Beck

reviews.text: It feels like the cinematic equivalent of the modern Internet experience.
reviews.author: Matt Brunson

reviews.text: Bizarre and more gore, but also much more badass and poetic. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Beatriz Martínez

reviews.text: While this one looks like it could be a kids superhero movie to an extent, don't be fooled: it's rough. It's a niche superhero movie and one for those with adventurous and not so easily offended taste.
reviews.author: Paul Salfen

reviews.text: Heads and shoulders above its predecessor, but - like Gunn's 'Guardians of the Galaxy' - its quirkiness and shock elements all feel safe and corporate-approved.
reviews.author: Witney Seibold

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is an uproarious extravaganza filled with grotesque nom-noms, full-on naked dick shots, and John Cena in tighty-whities and it's is the most fun you'll have with an R-rated comic book film in a theater since Deadpool.
reviews.author: Chris Sawin

reviews.text: The merits of bonkers violence and James Gunn's style are easy to find.
reviews.author: Don Shanahan

reviews.text: If there's only one true, declarative statement to be made about James Gunn's "The Suicide Squad," it would be that the film is entirely and undoubtedly a product of trust.
reviews.author: Luke Parker

reviews.text: If you're wondering how all of them manage to have a meaningful part that adds substance to Suicide Squad, don't. But adding logic to Suicide Squad is pointless.
reviews.author: MontiLee Stormer

reviews.text: You'll be lucky to have this much fun in a cinema again this year.
reviews.author: Matt Hudson

reviews.text: It's a hyper-violent, horny, gore spurting, roller coaster ride built around a warmly beating, but battered heart.
reviews.author: Dolores Quintana

reviews.text: Gunn gets in the zone, but it ends up being too little, too late.
reviews.author: Rubén Rosario

reviews.text: The film refuses to take itself seriously at the same time it manages to avoid the dangerous sanitization of violence thats so common in the genre. [Full review in Portuguese]
reviews.author: Pablo Villaça

reviews.text: A film can be funny and lively, use its main faces well, have a few nice moments with its supporting cast and improve on its predecessor, and yet still fall into a routine... keep rehashing the same things, and just be average.
reviews.author: Sarah Ward

reviews.text: Even when it doesn't work, the fact that it exists is a triumph.
reviews.author: Steven Prokopy

reviews.text: As much a jeering middle finger to the wannabe ratf*ckers who got Gunn fired from Disney as it is a joyous rejection of the so-called SnyderVerse.
reviews.author: Pete Vonder Haar

reviews.text: Comparing 2016's Suicide Squad to 2021's series reboot is like comparing day-old gas station sushi to three-star Michelin sushi chef Jiro Ono's finest dish.
reviews.author: Cory Woodroof

reviews.text: Its dark wit and ultraviolence may not be for everyone, but those who dig this tone will have a lot of fun watching and rewatching this crazy, chaotic - and unexpectedly touching - flick.
reviews.author: Sameen Amer

reviews.text: The film moves fast; it's forgettable and quite enjoyable.
reviews.author: Diane Pershing

reviews.text: While the film depicts the murder of a main character as a tragedy, it plays a boomerang slicing an anonymous soldier's head in half as a joke, suggesting that Gunn thinks violence is funny as long as it happens to other people.
reviews.author: Bennett Campbell Ferguson

reviews.text: Gunn is blissfully efficient in establishing the familiar rules to ensure it doesn't get bogged down in exposition, unlike the prior entry.
reviews.author: Chase Hutchinson

reviews.text: This is a comic book movie, not an adaptation vaguely embarrassed to be rooted in such source material like Joker or some of DC's more po-faced efforts.
reviews.author: Kayleigh Donaldson

reviews.text: Spectacle at its best, pathos at its most palpable. Maybe hyperbole, but I don't care. It's great!
reviews.author: Bill Arceneaux

reviews.text: If the film represents the DCEU finding its own unique voice, consider me impressed.
reviews.author: Aniruddho Chakraborty

reviews.text: Including so many characters and so much action and so much gore and so much swearing has only made it feel like a BIG yet somewhat empty film. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Sebastian Zavala Kahn

reviews.text: The outrageous avalanche of anarchy and energy is non-stop.
reviews.author: Filipe Freitas

reviews.text: Certainly an improvement over David Ayer's 2016 original, although that's a fairly low bar to clear.
reviews.author: Mattie Lucas

reviews.text: That's the biggest strength of The Suicide Squad -- embracing the capes-and-tights minutiae of an eight-decade-old medium to prove that the source material barely needs a punch-up to entertain the masses.
reviews.author: Eric Webb

reviews.text: This movie kept my attention more than any film I've watched over the past few months. It was fun and engaging to the point where I was entertained from start to finish.
reviews.author: Justin Brown

reviews.text: This was a genuine fun movie that had some sad and dark moments but they worked. It's hard to get all of those feels in one movie. Especially a comic book movie.
reviews.author: Brandon Collins

reviews.text: The social commentary might be blatant, but the over the top action and CGI-candy still leaves a bigger impression as a superhero movie is expected to these days.
reviews.author: Lina Lecaro

reviews.text: DC may often play second fiddle to Marvel, but this movie is DCEU done right. It's bloody, funny, and has just enough heart to make the band of merry misfit anti-heroes endearing. Plus, it's just a really, really wicked awesome movie.
reviews.author: Louisa Moore

reviews.text: An invigorating blast of bloody, disreputable comic-book cinema, "The Suicide Squad" turns its titular criminals into a collection of lovable anti-heroes set loose in a dazzling, surprisingly emotional adventure.
reviews.author: Tim Grierson

reviews.text: Gunn's assembled a bundle of messages here through the songs and stories his handiwork contains. In doing so, he's painted an illuminating portrait of who its maker is - but he hasn't crafted the kind of picture he should want to.
reviews.author: George Elkind

reviews.text: This is one sick, totally fun blast,
reviews.author: Bob Grimm

reviews.text: Stunning, bloody, strange and very entertaining despite all its hokum.
reviews.author: Dennis Schwartz

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is much better than its predecessor (it was not difficult to improve it). James Gunn's hand is very noticeable, offering us a fun movie with a fantastic soundtrack and blood, lots of blood. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Alvaro Corujo

reviews.text: The thing that makes The Suicide Squad so singularly distasteful is closely related to its factory-installed cynicism: the unconscionable glibness that grows out of it.
reviews.author: Glen Weldon

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is a magnificent blend of gore, heart, and humor that engages its audience instantly with strong characters, performances, and breathtaking visuals.
reviews.author: Amanda Mazzillo

reviews.text: I had a great time with this movie.
reviews.author: Andre Meadows

reviews.text: It can't stop nudging the audience about how ridiculous all of this is; the opening reel is essentially a series of eye-rolls about the film's own preposterousness, with the audience flattered at being in on the joke.
reviews.author: Robert Horton

reviews.text: Definitely a movie worth watching and enjoying. In so many ways, The Suicide Squad' lives up to its name, but I am starting to see the formulaic nature of superhero movies, which is worrisome.
reviews.author: Vincent Schilling

reviews.text: Imagine if Guardians of the Galaxy and Deadpool had some horribly beautiful baby.
reviews.author: Mark Meszoros

reviews.text: I've never been so annoyed by a movie in my entire life... way to gimmicky for its own good.
reviews.author: Shawn Edwards

reviews.text: From the bonkers fight choreography to the macabre logic driving the madcap action, this stylized comic book world looked nothing like ours, and was all the more transporting and entertaining for it.
reviews.author: Asia Frey

reviews.text: ...fares much, much better than David Ayer's misbegotten take on the DC Comics creation...
reviews.author: David Nusair

reviews.text: Here to have fun, and it succeeds without ever feeling weighed down by true nihilism or any agenda beyond entertaining the hell out of audiences.
reviews.author: Rob Hunter

reviews.text: James Gunn directed this inventive but only partially successful sequel.
reviews.author: Jackie K. Cooper

reviews.text: Gunn understands that the Squad is a group of misfits and he uses their reduced status to make them effective underdogs. More importantly, his screenplay has a beating heart underneath the gore.
reviews.author: Tim Brennan

reviews.text: It's arguably the strongest of all the recent DC films so far, and a hopeful sign that the studio has a brighter future ahead.
reviews.author: Nicolás Delgadillo

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad explodes with loopy mix of horror and sick humor.
reviews.author: Dann Gire

reviews.text: Here, everyone just does what they want, and that's really good news for a DC Comics movie. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Ruben Peralta Rigaud

reviews.text: Where "The Suicide Squad" really succeeds, and separates itself from its predecessor (which was more about America relying on bad people to do our dirty business), is re-framing its characters as victims, not just villains.
reviews.author: Neil Morris

reviews.text: Love the cast dynamic, violent gory kills, humor, soundtrack, and even the heartfelt moments. Only Gunn can make me care about a rat who waves.
reviews.author: Rosa Parra

reviews.text: The film's final nemesis is a hoot, but it's also genuinely creepy.
reviews.author: Randall King

reviews.text: With its insane action set-pieces, strong performances from its lead cast, and bucket loads of gore, The Suicide Squad could easily be one of the best superhero movies ever made.
reviews.author: David Gelmini

reviews.text: The movie's saving grace lies in its willingness to embrace the ridiculous and, in the process, poke fun at the kind of movie it easily could have been; i.e., one that took itself more more seriously...
reviews.author: Robert Denerstein

reviews.text: If billionaires wanna set their money on fire by using computers to animate the 12th Doctor (Peter Capaldi) staring down a several-skyscraper-sized creature named Starro, that is almost certainly less evil than whatever else they were going to do with it.
reviews.author: Ryan Syrek

reviews.text: If you enjoy cartoonish excess even when it extends to violence then this hard R, DC Comics super anti-hero action film is exactly what you need.
reviews.author: Beth Accomando

reviews.text: It's corporate irreverence, which means fundamentally and most urgently it's a safe space for viewers. It's also pretty funny at times.
reviews.author: Stephen Garrett

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is fun and funny, though the over-the-top violence won't appeal to everyone.
reviews.author: Sarah Marrs

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is brutal, funny and brutally funny, illustrative of the possibilities that develop when comic book cinema doesn't take itself quite so seriously. All in all, it's a hell of a good time.
reviews.author: Allen Adams

reviews.text: Its crazy visuals and violence is complemented by a crazier bunch of characters, a fun story, and more than its fair share of heartwarming moments.
reviews.author: Nicholas Oon

reviews.text: Better, more entertaining, and cohesive than its predecessor. And if you don't mind the decidedly R-rated material, you might just enjoy this wild and crazy ride.
reviews.author: Jim Judy

reviews.text: There's little question this entire escapade is so much better than the last one, hardly a high bar to hurdle, and I did have a pretty good time.
reviews.author: Kate Rodger

reviews.text: Maybe it didn't need to be two hours 12 minutes long but for the most part, The Suicide Squad earns its length.
reviews.author: Jorge Ignacio Castillo

reviews.text: It's a swell tribute to Gunn's origins as a genre filmmaker while demonstrating his essential skill as both a writer and director of populist blockbusters.
reviews.author: Nick Johnston

reviews.text: Full of gleeful gore and carnage, infectiously silly jokes, and an overall vulgar, irreverent attitude, this wily, invigorating DCEU movie also offers surprisingly strong teamwork and lots of heart.
reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Anderson

reviews.text: 'The Suicide Squad' represents the very best that DC films can be, taking the kind of risks that you wouldn't see in a Marvel property.
reviews.author: Damian Levy

reviews.text: Sidestepping the silliness of the plot, it's joyous fun throughout; the entire cast is a blast, not least Peter Capaldi's mad-scientist baddie, the Thinker.
reviews.author: Terry Staunton

reviews.text: If there was even an iota of human emotion evident the movie would be unbearable as well as increasingly vile. But there isn't, so instead it's just kind of exhausting...
reviews.author: Mark Feeney

reviews.text: There's stuff in this movie that will make you cringe even as you're doubled over with laughter, to be sure, but what makes this the kind of film audiences will keep coming back to is the sense of emotional range woven through the whole thing.
reviews.author: Matthew Jackson

reviews.text: James Gunn's The Suicide Squad puts the DC Comics franchise back on track by playing to everyone's strengths.
reviews.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore

reviews.text: An entertaining comic film and a breath of fresh air in the midst of so much homogeneity in the genre. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Emmanuel Báez

reviews.text: Clears the subterranean bar set by Ayer's botched attempt while also making one yearn for the next Guardians of the Galaxy film.
reviews.author: Edwin Arnaudin

reviews.text: Ultimately, The Suicide Squad is a fun, if overlong, superhero blockbuster, but it's nothing special and it's certainly not anything new.
reviews.author: Kyle Logan

reviews.text: A fun time with just enough of a nasty edge to feel like it has a personality.
reviews.author: Tim Brayton

reviews.text: If the ham-fisted glut of multi-million dollar special effects don't dazzle you, then the calibre of The Suicide Squad's genuinely impressive ensemble cast by all rights should.
reviews.author: Alexandra Heller-Nicholas

reviews.text: It's just as dull as the predecessor. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Yasser Medina

reviews.text: I didn't think I'd have fun with a movie like this again - a huge - budget Mystery Men aiming for, and nailing, its hard-R. More, please.
reviews.author: Walter Chaw

reviews.text: The pacing is a bit off and the story veers a bit too much when trying to layer in political drama where no one asked for it, but it's mostly a good way to watch fun characters doing silly and badass things.
reviews.author: Lindsay Traves

reviews.text: Writer-director John Gunn certainly leaves a giant thumbprint on this merry 2-hour and 4-minute meatgrinder.
reviews.author: Anne Brodie

reviews.text: There's more pathos in King Shark sitting in the back of a van, silently watching the grit of an island's back alleys pass by, than your average bullet fest.
reviews.author: Alci Rengifo

reviews.text: A singularly different and infinitely better experience than David Ayer's grim predecessor.
reviews.author: Mel Valentin

reviews.text: Has added a lot of things that the previous film lacked- excitement, joy, coherent action, and decent filmmaking.
reviews.author: Stephen Silver

reviews.text: Of course, creating multifaceted, endearing villains beyond the stereotypical "mustache-twirling" isn't a novel concept. But in Gunn's hands, it soars to new heights.
reviews.author: Melody McCune

reviews.text: James Gunn's The Suicide Squad is just about as much fun as a person can have in a theatre without getting arrested
reviews.author: Robert Slack

reviews.text: With little exposition and no character development, there's no emotional resonance, making it more of a grotesque, R-rated comic-book-turned-video game than a movie.
reviews.author: Susan Granger

reviews.text: So, yes, let's get this out of the way: The Suicide Squad is better than Suicide Squad. How could it not be?
reviews.author: Chris Evangelista

reviews.text: The movie is too much, too long, but not lacking in its glories. To find them, follow Harley. She's leading the way.
reviews.author: K. Austin Collins

reviews.text: The most imaginative DC film so far, veering from laugh-out-loud hilarity to horror, shifting from pathos to extraordinary violence that would make Quentin Tarantino question its excesses.
reviews.author: Ani Bundel

reviews.text: With The Suicide Squad, Gunn shows that there are ways to keep things edgy while at the same time offering enough humor and action to maintain the crowd-pleasing elements.
reviews.author: James Berardinelli

reviews.text: [A] glorious gun-blazing tour de farce of impressively immense scope & unrestrained storytelling, from a brilliant filmmaker operating at the top of his game.
reviews.author: Mark Hughes

reviews.text: James Gunn shoots his "Dirty Dozen"-like tale with comic-book images galore, hits on a heavy bundle of 'em, but barely misses overkill by the end. Crazy stuff!
reviews.author: John Urbancich

reviews.text: A fun, gory and action-packed adventure that gives every one of its antiheroes a moment to shine. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Rene Sanchez

reviews.text: Yet another mindless, overproduced B-movie that's neither funny, exciting nor campy enough to be a guilty pleasure.
reviews.author: Avi Offer

reviews.text: Yes, this DCU movie is a bit more bearable than Marvel's most recent film, Black Widow, but saying that is not much different than saying that some stinky shit is better than other stinky shit. The truth is that the two movies are still shit.
reviews.author: Ernesto Diezmartinez

reviews.text: Mission accomplished.
reviews.author: Michael Ward

reviews.text: 'The Suicide Squad' gets by on its performances, but it punches down far more than necessary and misses the emotional connections of Gunn's other contemporary work.
reviews.author: Amelia Emberwing

reviews.text: Q: So who are the good guys? A: There are no good guys.
reviews.author: Chris McCoy

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad prioritizes jokes to such an extent that the film starts to fall apart whenever it's required to function like a story, two hours of cinematic cotton candy.
reviews.author: Ian Thomas Malone

reviews.text: An exuberant, violent, and hilariously goofy superhero romp.
reviews.author: Allen Almachar

reviews.text: Mayhem is the name of the game in this iteration, and boy, has pandemonium never felt so good.
reviews.author: Candice McMillan

reviews.text: This tenth installment in the DCEU is a fast-paced, blood-soaked, wildly irreverent escapade that skillfully balances gore and goofiness, with equal amounts of irreverence and sincerity. Think The Boys pumped up on a steroids.
reviews.author: Jennifer Ouellette

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad serves as a boundary-pushing switch up from the superhero's conformed image.
reviews.author: Matt Conway

reviews.text: One crazy kaleidoscope of brassy bloodshed. Anything that features a giant, pastel colored starfish lumbering about wrecking havoc, must be seen.
reviews.author: Lisa Johnson Mandell

reviews.text: Gunn has finally made a Troma movie on a big Hollywood budget.
reviews.author: Sean P. Means

reviews.text: aka 'Suicide Squad 2: Sorry About Suicide Squad 1'
reviews.author: Bob Chipman

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is a strong, fresh, and ultra-violent sequel that is distinctly Gunn's vision through each step. A good example for WB of what happens when the studio trusts its director to deliver.
reviews.author: Sheraz Farooqi

reviews.text: It's colorful, yet somber; hilarious, yet profound; violent, yet tender. It's a whole host of discordant ideas which come together as only a James Gunn film can, bringing all the highs and lows one has come to expect from the just-off-center director.
reviews.author: Douglas Davidson

reviews.text: Through all the mayhem, "The Suicide Squad" feels like it's trying too hard to prove that it's better than the previous film, which grows tiresome after a while.
reviews.author: Matthew Passantino

reviews.text: Gunn's movie is wondrously wild, delightfully deranged and viscerally violent.
reviews.author: Wenlei Ma

reviews.text: Fast-paced, violent fun.
reviews.author: Linda Cook

reviews.text: The jocular élan with which the Squad dispatches victims is a trademark of the franchise. And they don't just slaughter bad guys:
reviews.author: Bill Newcott

reviews.text: This movie is a lot, and a lot of it rules.
reviews.author: Matt Pais

reviews.text: Despite the blood and gore, "The Suicide Squad" is comedic in tone, eschewing the oppressive seriousness of its DC cinematic colleagues.
reviews.author: Bob Bloom

reviews.text: I think [Gunn] stretches himself too thin by the end's contractually obligated vomiting of computer-graphics, but the jokes and action prove more than enough to compensate.
reviews.author: Jared Mobarak

reviews.text: James Gunn has carved out his own niche and The Suicide Squad might enter him in with the greats (if he's not there already). Unlike the 2016 effort, this doesn't feel studio tainted in the slightest. It's 100% grade A choice Gunn. And bloody.
reviews.author: Lee McCoy

reviews.text: We're not supposed to notice all this pilfering from movies of our childhood, but I noticed them. This movie is a mess.
reviews.author: Tim Cogshell

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad confirms more than ever that Warner Bros. is just completely astray with the DCEU films.
reviews.author: Wade Major

reviews.text: The first half is everything you could want from a superhero movie and the second half is everything we've sadly come to expect from them.
reviews.author: Vincent Mancini

reviews.text: When it is violent and extreme, this is when it's fun... I had a blast watching this.
reviews.author: Kevin Carr

reviews.text: Under Gunn's well-suited direction, The Suicide Squad becomes a grimy romp, full of self-aware humor, baked-in absurdity and just enough pathos to let you know he doesn't consider the whole thing a joke.
reviews.author: Abby Olcese

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad will play well with comic book fans, but casual movie goers may be a harder sell with this material.
reviews.author: Paul McGuire Grimes

reviews.text: While there's a reasonable amount of fun to be had from the mayhem, things never get quite as gonzo as the trailers promised. Overall, you get the sense that the once-canceled Gunn has become gun-shy.
reviews.author: Megan Basham

reviews.text: "The Suicide Squad" is the most subversive mainstream blockbuster since Ryan Reynolds, in character, was told by his blind roommate that a red suit was a good idea because, after all, it would hide the blood.
reviews.author: Jonathan W. Hickman

reviews.text: James Gunn's film kills. Oh, and you thought a talking tree was weird...
reviews.author: Jeff Mitchell

reviews.text: It's fantastic a comic book movie with a Troma gloss...
reviews.author: Felix Vasquez Jr.

reviews.text: There are just enough passages in it where it comes good in its remit -- even if that remit mightn't be your particular cup of shark soup.
reviews.author: Hilary A White

reviews.text: 'The Suicide Squad' chokes a little on its own supply, but enough joy can be found to mark it a winner.
reviews.author: Preston Barta

reviews.text: As if a James Gunn Guardians of the Galaxy film had been cast with characters from Arkham Asylum.
reviews.author: James Verniere

reviews.text: Here's a hot take for you: I had more fun in this movie than either of Gunn's Guardians of the Galaxy films.
reviews.author: Andy Downing

reviews.text: James Gunn takes what was a frantically paced mess and turns it into an off-the-wall good time that leans into hilariously brutal violence but with a surprisingly moving emotional center.
reviews.author: Brendan Morrow

reviews.text: [James Gunn] has created a superhero movie that equally celebrates and mocks its genre, all while taking the audience on one of the wildest rides imaginable.
reviews.author: Damond Fudge

reviews.text: It's not often a potential franchise gets a do-over. Warner Bros. was lucky to get Gunn and even smarter to stay out of his way in The Suicide Squad.
reviews.author: George M. Thomas

reviews.text: The energy in this picture is non-stop. A joke or a skillfully executed action scene is never far off.
reviews.author: Mike McGranaghan

reviews.text: Despite the trappings of the modern Hollywood formula, The Suicide Squad breaks the mold as best it can with a multi-million dollar budget that spared no expense when it came to blood & guts
reviews.author: Jonathan DeHaan

reviews.text: [It's] as if Gunn wanted to challenge himself to make such an underpowered crew perform at the highest levels, as a lark, just to see if he could pull it off. He mostly does, I guess?
reviews.author: Piers Marchant

reviews.text: A huge improvement on the original and, without question, a James Gunn film. The characters and action are great, but the film sacrifices all emotional impact and it may prove less memorable than some of Gunn's other outings.
reviews.author: Jack Cameron

reviews.text: Fun and Bloody Adventure
reviews.author: Kathia Woods

reviews.text: The lack of narrative momentum or compelling character arcs starts to wear on you. The jokes get old, too.
reviews.author: Bilge Ebiri

reviews.text: This is the best Marvel movie that DC has ever made
reviews.author: Larry Carroll

reviews.text: The film has its fun moments, and represents an improvement on the first Suicide Squad, which I know isn't saying much.
reviews.author: Chris Knight

reviews.text: Gunn is much better suited to the material, though while the end result is gorier, funnier and occasionally more heartfelt [than its predecessor], it doesn't quite coalesce into something totally fun, or totally meaningful.
reviews.author: Siddhant Adlakha

reviews.text: Storm Reid and Idris Elba have the best scene ever and the women of this franchise, Margot Robbie, Viola Davis and Daniela Melchior make the overly violent, comedically quirky franchise worth the watch for me
reviews.author: Carla Renata

reviews.text: I'm in for tight storytelling, sidesplitting lines and impeccable timing. However... It's like there's a contest we don't know about to see who can be the sickest, grossest, most ridiculous snuff deviant in the cinematic universe. Unnecessary.
reviews.author: Lonita Cook

reviews.text: Gunn finds ways to almost continually surprise and delight us.
reviews.author: Abbie Bernstein

reviews.text: Yeah, yeah, you may want to say, life sucks, got it. Even so, there's a lot to like in the film.
reviews.author: M.V. Moorhead

reviews.text: Much like Guardians of the Galaxy, The Suicide Squad is exceptionally good at taking mismatched characters and making them gel thanks to the strength of its script and well-calibrated performances.
reviews.author: Joshua Rivera

reviews.text: Writer-director James Gunn, a veteran of the Troma Z-movie factory, has imbued the picture with a proud neo-junkiness, and the good news is that it's intermittently entertaining.
reviews.author: Kurt Loder

reviews.text: I don't hate The Suicide Squad ... but I do feel somewhat bludgeoned by it, as if I'm being a stick-in-the-mud for failing to fall in line and revel in the absurdity.
reviews.author: Sonny Bunch

reviews.text: Everything you like about James Gunn's wild, violent, irreverent style is on display, maybe to a fault.
reviews.author: Evan Dossey

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is fluid, the narrative structure is off-kilter and fractured just like its team, and it is often absolutely hilarious in-and-out of the insanity happening in front of us.
reviews.author: Aaron Peterson

reviews.text: Gunn has made this movie fun even if formulaic, and in doing so, he may have not only saved The Suicide Squad, but he's perhaps resuscitated the DCCU itself.
reviews.author: Tom Santilli

reviews.text: Gunn's violent, chaotic, hilarious and sneakily heartfelt vision are all safely intact resulting in easily one of the best DC Extended Universe films.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Lyles

reviews.text: It's a combination that, by rights, should not come together. Yet it does.
reviews.author: Sean Collier

reviews.text: This is FUN. Yes, with all capital letters, because I really need to get that point across...it's the film the original Suicide Squad was trying to be. And I'm here for it.
reviews.author: Johnny Gayzmonic

reviews.text: It has the good sense to celebrate bad taste, and it is all the better for it.
reviews.author: Alan Zilberman

reviews.text: A quasi-sequel, quasi-reboot that breathes new life into the franchise as James Gunn brings his Guardians of the Galaxy flare into the DC universe while at the same time delivering the most outrageous and gruesome bloodbath the superhero genre has seen.
reviews.author: Matt Rodriguez

reviews.text: Gunn is now undisputed king of both sides of the comic book movie fence.
reviews.author: Phil Villarreal

reviews.text: The gloriously unhinged James Gunn keeps Margot Robbie, John Cena and a top cast of crazies firing on all cylinders and turns a botch job original that was the worst movie of 2016 into the down-and-dirty whirlwind it was always meant to be.
reviews.author: Peter Travers

reviews.text: This movie is more interested in how many ways a human body can be dismembered than it is in anything else with the possible exception of macho posturing.
reviews.author: Nell Minow

reviews.text: [James Gunn] gets to embrace his B-movie sensibility in all its R-rated glory. One that is gleefully violent, gory, and profane.
reviews.author: Casey Chong

reviews.text: This is what happens when you hire an excepcional creator, give him a juicy license, free him from any kind of ties and make things easier for him with a generous budget. Glorious.
reviews.author: Víctor López G.

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is the best DC movie in decades. A high watermark for comic book cinema and blockbusters in general. Hilarious, horrifying, and heartfelt in equal measure.
reviews.author: Drew Dietsch

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is a self-contained exercise in maximalist storytelling, the likes of which we see only rarely. It might be the most deviant-minded mainstream superhero movie since Taika Waititi's Thor: Ragnarok.
reviews.author: Rohan Naahar

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad can't be accused for being standard or timid. It's easily one of the most outrageous movies of 2021, following its own path, and being led by the wild mind of James Gunn.
reviews.author: Leo Brady

reviews.text: [James] Gunn operating with his raw sensibilities and shredding what hasn't worked for him before. [...] Gunn has delivered a zany, gory, crazy adventure at his most unhinged - more than he's allowed to be at Marvel, or he's allowed himself to be.
reviews.author: Akhil Arora

reviews.text: The constant assault of gags, combined with the routine plotting ... creates its own deflating sense of repetition.
reviews.author: Mark Dujsik

reviews.text: While not quite the breath of fresh air that, say, Birds of Prey was last year, this is still the all too rare superhero flick made with purpose outside of what's coming next.
reviews.author: Matthew Dougherty

reviews.text: A careful corporate product that for all its naughty posturing is about as edgy and dangerous as a trip to the mall, with production design by Hot Topic and bad jokes from Spencer's Gifts.
reviews.author: Sean Burns

reviews.text: (Gunn) lays everything on way too thick in the third act and the romp becomes exhausting. The movie is far too long and too grotesque for its own good.
reviews.author: Jeff York

reviews.text: Irreverent and funny in a midnight movie way, "Suicide Squad" is a shameless guilty pleasure.
reviews.author: Russ Simmons

reviews.text: While The Suicide Squad isn't exactly the masterpiece fans may be hoping for, it's definitely an upgrade.
reviews.author: Skylar Ezell

reviews.text: James Gunn at his meanest, bloodiest, and funniest. This is what the first Suicide Squad should have been.
reviews.author: Doug Walker

reviews.text: James Gunn finally handles a multi-character DC film in a way that works. Blending The Belko Experiment with Tromeo & Juliet and playing with super-villains, we finally get the Suicide Squad we had hoped for.
reviews.author: Bill Watters

reviews.text: James Gunn, Troma alum, taps into his gruesome imagination in a way we haven't seen since the era of Slither and Super.
reviews.author: Dan Scully

reviews.text: It's still badly overcrowded, with an exhausting barrage of hyper-violent mayhem. But there's some charm in the characters, and the actors add plenty of sassy banter.
reviews.author: Rich Cline

reviews.text: Fans will be plenty sated.
reviews.author: Luke Goodsell

reviews.text: The amazing thing is just how much Gunn can make you care about these killers... You might even feel something for the starfish.
reviews.author: Jonathan Roberts

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is bloody fun ride with a lovable cast to match.
reviews.author: Emmanuel Noisette

reviews.text: Writer/Director James Gunn takes the original concept and turns it into ultra violent, profane bloody, funny Harley Quinn-tessential mayhem.
reviews.author: Linda and Al Lerner

reviews.text: Gunn was clearly the ideal skipper to navigate the Squad's subversive, irreverent hard-R-rated waters.
reviews.author: Randy Myers

reviews.text: What [James Gunn] can do is let his squad have fun, and fun they have, proving that modern non-Batman DC works best at its silliest.
reviews.author: Richard Whittaker

reviews.text: Like the film in which he appears, King Shark revels in the chaos and the carnage, having a really good time as the world burns. Odds are, you will too.
reviews.author: Allison Shoemaker

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is very funny, bleakly self-aware, and shockingly violent -- a refreshing mix of familiar conventions and gory satire. In a sea of sequels, reboots, crossovers, and origin stories, it stands out like few other recent adaptations have.
reviews.author: David Sims

reviews.text: To his credit, Gunn deftly juggles a dizzying assortment of elements, creating memorable moments for his principals (Robbie, for example, fares much better here than in Harley's dedicated showcase vehicle).
reviews.author: Brian Lowry

reviews.text: Each character has their moment of glory. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Sergio López Aguirre

reviews.text: With a crazy number of death-as-punchline moments and more ridiculous heroes than you can shake a giant alien starfish at, this DC Comics adaptation is an absolute hoot.
reviews.author: Dominic Corry

reviews.text: A fun exercise that's a marked improvement on WB's last attempt with this property, but it doesn't feel quite as emotionally resonant or uproariously funny as it seems to think it is.
reviews.author: Dominic Griffin

reviews.text: I don't know if I'll ever be a connoisseur of kill-shot comedy...
reviews.author: Josh Larsen

reviews.text: There were quite a few moments in this movie that I found hilarious, and they absolutely do outweigh the moments that were just kind of a miss for me.
reviews.author: Jeremy Jahns

reviews.text: The movie's supposed to be Elba's, and while his Bloodsport's sword-waving with Peacemaker is puckishly good second-tier fun, the shine here is Quinn. No Quinn, no movie.
reviews.author: Tom Meek

reviews.text: Not every film can follow this blueprint, but if future DCEU movies can be even half as fun as The Suicide Squad, they'll be on the right path. It's over-the-top, ultra-violent, illogical, and it's a blast.
reviews.author: Alex Bentley

reviews.text: Suicide Squad is by far the best DC movie made of late. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Pablo O. Scholz

reviews.text: Proudly profane/violently R-rated, & also relying on excellent/weird characters, TSS satisfies from beginning to glorious end. And according to Polka-Dot Man, Oedipal Wrecks!
reviews.author: Patrick McDonald

reviews.text: "The Suicide Squad" stands on its own in a way superhero movies often don't. I feel confident audiences will be satisfied about where it ends, even if it does leave us hoping to see more of this team.
reviews.author: Chris Hewitt

reviews.text: Yes, it's still entertaining and rattles along at a reasonable pace. But scratch below the wafer-thin bonkers plot and gleeful mugging and the film seems to be rather less than the sum of its parts.
reviews.author: Stefan Kyriazis

reviews.text: The violence is the most consistently inventive part of the whole package, though it grows tiresome in its thudding repetition.
reviews.author: Manohla Dargis

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is a bloody and gory good time, which is to be expected, but thanks to some standout performances from the cast, it also has a lot of heart that makes you care about these people even while we hear about the terrible things they did.
reviews.author: Kaitlyn Booth

reviews.text: Flamboyantly nasty, garishly gory trash-but an efficiently manufactured example of such stuff, which succeeds on its own admittedly sophomoric terms.
reviews.author: Frank Swietek

reviews.text: The result is a bit better, the film improving on its predecessor in some areas, treading water in others.
reviews.author: Charles Koplinski

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is a raucous mixture of hilarity and unrestrained violence.
reviews.author: Rob Dean

reviews.text: There's a real sense of narrative momentum ... the story feels like it's purposefully snowballing until the eventual reveal of an unexpected, much weirder villain.
reviews.author: Matt Lynch

reviews.text: Gunn masterfully mixes humor and bloodshed and manages to give a surprising number of characters room to develop their personas. And when it comes to staging set pieces, he's at his best.
reviews.author: Soren Andersen

reviews.text: The Squad is dead! Long live The Squad!
reviews.author: Johnny Oleksinski

reviews.text: Prepare to be splattered, but also satisfied in a summer blockbuster kind of way.
reviews.author: Peter Howell

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad misses the mark almost from the very beginning as it makes its descent into the bowels of film making.
reviews.author: Allison Rose

reviews.text: Gunn comes in locked and loaded, and he pushes the envelope with everything he couldn't do in Disney's Marvel universe.
reviews.author: Adam Graham

reviews.text: While The Suicide Squad is perhaps more aggressively violent than any recent entry in the action genre, it is definitely funnier than most films calling themselves comedies in recent times.
reviews.author: Leigh Paatsch

reviews.text: "The Suicide Squad," however pessimistic, scratches a thrilling midnight movie itch.
reviews.author: Pat Padua

reviews.text: A nihilistic orgy of brightly coloured gore and violence apparently envisioned while on mushrooms. If you're sitting near the front of an IMAX theatre, it plays like being in the "splash-zone" of a GWAR concert.
reviews.author: Jim Slotek

reviews.text: Director James Gunn tempers the gross stuff with a certain kind of sweetness and some not-so-subtle social commentary.
reviews.author: Richard Crouse

reviews.text: Embracing the weird is key to enjoying James Gunn's gory, expletive-filled, hilariously twisted take on DC Comics' fictional antihero team.
reviews.author: Rebecca Murray

reviews.text: There is not much that can be said about the plot without ruining its best parts, but it can be noted that this is very much writer-director James Gunn's movie.
reviews.author: John Lui

reviews.text: Elba gives Bloodsport an exhausted but appealing edge with surprising vulnerability. Dastmalchian and Stallone mine genuine humanity out of their goofy characters, and Malchior is the beating heart of The Suicide Squad.
reviews.author: Brandon Zachary

reviews.text: For the first hour of The Suicide Squad I found myself on the edge of my seat, truly feeling like I was watching something fresh.
reviews.author: Mike Ryan

reviews.text: ...a hyper-violent, noisy, brash, stylish and frequently hilarious shot in the arm for superhero movies...
reviews.author: Anthony O'Connor

reviews.text: James Gunn holds nothing back in this wickedly entertaining orgy of blood, guts and F-bombs. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Mario Alegre

reviews.text: Essentially a sarcastic, post-ironic action painting of splurge thrown on the biggest screen possible...just, stuff on the screen, some of which is quite bonkers and funny, but it felt like a big inside joke, that was my problem...
reviews.author: Mark Kermode

reviews.text: Maybe it is its own triumph to have at least stretched a rigid medium into new shapes for a little while. The Suicide Squad can't hold the pose for long, but while it does, it's an enjoyable flex.
reviews.author: Richard Lawson

reviews.text: Its foulmouthed energy gives new life to the superhero genre, which has threatened to become too stolid attempting to appeal to the kids.
reviews.author: Kristian M. Lin

reviews.text: while Gunn maintains his usual baseline of irreverent humor and character work in The Suicide Squad, this is the first of his movies that suggests he could stand to learn some new tricks.
reviews.author: Luke Y. Thompson

reviews.text: A second crack at Suicide Squad' surpasses the original...Harley Quinn and Rick Flag are back in a delirious mashup full of humor and head-splitting.
reviews.author: Richard Roeper

reviews.text: "The Suicide Squad" is juvenile fun of the highest measure with just the tiniest bit of heart to make you not feel like a complete degenerate for reveling in all the onscreen carnage.
reviews.author: Mathew DeKinder

reviews.text: It's a thrill to look at Viola Davis unmoved face when her character realizes the poor job her staff has done while putting together a team of assassins. Plus, she looks great in a lilac pencil skirt power suit.
reviews.author: Patricia Puentes

reviews.text: It is a fast-paced thrill ride from start to finish, and Gunn's style is a perfect fit. All of this makes it one of the best movies of the year.
reviews.author: Austin Burke

reviews.text: Surprisingly conventional for a comic book movie that weaponizes polka dots.
reviews.author: Matt Oakes

reviews.text: Tries to reset the brand name for future abuse, but with a weird blend of reverence and irreverence Gunn is better at communicating when denied permission to indulge his love of extremity.
reviews.author: Brian Orndorf

reviews.text: Gory, sentimental, brazenly adolescent, and never short on imagination, The Suicide Squad could be described as the essence of Gunn, if not exactly the film of a free man.
reviews.author: Jake Wilson

reviews.text: Some movies leave you wanting more. "The Suicide Squad" is a blast, for a while, but it leaves you wanting less.
reviews.author: Daniel Neman

reviews.text: Reader, I enjoyed it.
reviews.author: Michael Phillips

reviews.text: In "The Suicide Squad," writer-director James Gunn has done the seemingly impossible: He has found the fun in the Suicide Squad
reviews.author: Mick LaSalle

reviews.text: This is so clearly the film that they should have made the first time around that even as you watch it unfold with various degrees of delight and disbelief, you may find yourself hating the earlier film all the more.
reviews.author: Peter Sobczynski

reviews.text: Jettisoning most of the characters from the 2016 movie and leaning hard into absurd elements, writer-director James Gunn orchestrates a mostly funny mission-from-hell adventure that ranks right up there among the goriest comedies ever made.
reviews.author: Kyle Smith

reviews.text: It's not often a comic book flick will have you critiquing Reagan-era politics while also enjoying the lizard-brain pleasures of a creature feature smash-em-up, but that's just the special sauce that James Gunn brings.
reviews.author: Katie Walsh

reviews.text: James Gunn nails the antihero saga, brings Harley Quinn back from the woke ledge.
reviews.author: Christian Toto

reviews.text: It has so much of the glossy sheen of the pages of a graphic novel that you can practically smell the ink. A huge improvement on the first film.
reviews.author: Dan Murrell

reviews.text: An enjoyably overstuffed summer blockbuster that easily could have been as calamitous as its predecessor.
reviews.author: Cary Darling

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is the best film of the year so far and not just an instant genre classic, but a classic on the whole.
reviews.author: Joey Magidson

reviews.text: Thanks to a much clearer vision, this remarkably strong comic book movie pulls no punches in its attempts at pitch-black comedy, gory violence, and a total sense of irreverence.
reviews.author: Aaron Neuwirth

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is a devilishly funny hurricane of carnage. Writer/director James Gunn has a field day exploring the bizarre abilities of his freakshow team.
reviews.author: Julian Roman

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is a masterclass in its own genre, coming from the creative, albeit dangerous mind of James Gunn. It entertains from start to finish, it isn't afraid to be ultraviolent while being superbly funny.
reviews.author: Zofia Wijaszka

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad shares more in common with a show like Amazon's The Boys than Wonder Woman or Justice League, and that's a unique space that plays well to James Gunn's strengths as a filmmaker.
reviews.author: Rick Marshall

reviews.text: What's exciting about this second time at bat for the franchise is that it perfectly marries the two seemingly oppositional phases of Gunn's filmmaking career.
reviews.author: Kyle Pinion

reviews.text: It's endearingly sweet, even as it's spilling brain matter and gore by the bucket load.
reviews.author: Meagan Navarro

reviews.text: It's more fun than it should be, considering the violence tends to grow repetitive; visual grotesqueries lose their potency when so much of the picture is an orgy of death.
reviews.author: Mike Massie

reviews.text: This Year You Will Believe that The Suicide Squad Will Make You Cry
reviews.author: Andrew F. Peirce

reviews.text: A director-driven deranged masterpiece of a live-action comic book movie, unlike anything I've seen before.
reviews.author: Rendy Jones

reviews.text: One of the best comic book movies in years, and easily the best DC one since Christopher Nolan had his hands on some of these characters.
reviews.author: Jon Negroni

reviews.text: Spanks the 2016 film and sends it off to the corner to think about what it did. This one is the definite article: Gory, grim, bleakly funny. Full of feverish, anarchic energy and exhausting cynicism.
reviews.author: MaryAnn Johanson

reviews.text: Throughout, James Gunn renders the half-grim, half-absurdist nature of the Suicide Squad with delightfully bloody abandon.
reviews.author: Jake Cole

reviews.text: James Gunn's gleefully irreverent second stab at the infamous DC comics property, "The Suicide Squad" feels like a refreshing dose of sarcasm in a genre that often takes itself too seriously.
reviews.author: Nate Adams

reviews.text: Violence and gore coat a creamy, heart-filled center.
reviews.author: Steven Farshid

reviews.text: Lean, mean, and stuffed to the gills with charisma, James Gunn's The Suicide Squad just wants to save the world, one f**k-up at a time.
reviews.author: André Hereford

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is that rare sequel that far exceeds its predecessor.
reviews.author: Alan Ng

reviews.text: With a robustly anarchic air, The Suicide Squad is funnier, grittier, more sardonic and better cast than its predecessor - and, with its love for comedy infused ultra-violence, both more grown-up and a lot sillier.
reviews.author: Emma Simmonds

reviews.text: A giddily violent, gory, and outlandish romp that will leave you richly satisfied, 'The Suicide Squad' reaches a new pinnacle for the DCEU.
reviews.author: Doug Jamieson

reviews.text: I laughed and cried with "The Suicide Squad," not be confused with 2016's "Suicide Squad" which lacked the article defining it as well as a sense of humor, rhythm, or focus.
reviews.author: Roger Friedman

reviews.text: If you're an adult with a penchant for blood, gore and hilarity combined, don't miss Gunn's homage to these maniacal villains.
reviews.author: Jeanne Kaplan

reviews.text: THE SUICIDE SQUAD is as deserving of an R-rating as any movie, but it's all in the name of campy fun.
reviews.author: David Kaplan

reviews.text: James Gunn has spiced the broth but it's still thin and no substitute for a decent meal.
reviews.author: Ed Whitfield

reviews.text: the real heroes of "The Suicide Squad" are not the movie stars or the effects mavens. It is the huge list of stunt people involved in the making of the copious action.
reviews.author: Robin Clifford

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is James Gunn at his most unhinged, unrestrained and unleashed, but the result is one of the best DC movies in years.
reviews.author: Scott Campbell

reviews.text: The key: a director with a taste for anarchy, who crawled out of the same toxic sewer sludge as most of the characters.
reviews.author: Wendy Ide

reviews.text: James Gunn sets things right with the new Squad. It's DCEU's grittiest and most irreverent movie to date. Luckily the new character's charming qualities and the group's chemistry outweigh the weakest part of the movie - the human villains.
reviews.author: Lupe Rodriguez Haas

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is the superhero movie equivalent of someone who will kiss you and kick you at the same time. Within the first 15 minutes of the movie, there are surprises that most superhero movies would never dare to have.
reviews.author: Carla Hay

reviews.text: Though not to be confused with the 2016 action caper Suicide Squad, James Gunn's noisy sequel aims for a similar style and tone -- trashy and unpleasant. In this, and this alone, it succeeds.
reviews.author: Paul Whitington

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is an absolute blast...
reviews.author: Brian Viner

reviews.text: This truly is a DC comic brought to life, smashing together bright colours and fantastical visuals with the most cartoonish violence this side of an Itchy & Scratchy episode.
reviews.author: Jennifer Heaton

reviews.text: It is not for children. It's not really for adults either. But the eternal inner adolescent that lives within us all will almost certainly have a swell time.
reviews.author: Donald Clarke

reviews.text: It's not a comic book movie classic but you'll have a bloody good time with The Suicide Squad, an action-packed, often hilarious, take on Task Force X that breathes new life into the DC Extended Universe even if occasionally strikes a bum note.
reviews.author: Josh Wilding

reviews.text: Gunn's screenplay doesn't shy away from political commentary while he's generally having a blast righting the Squad ship left floundering in 2016. It is no surprise that this Suicide Squad has a very Guardians feel.
reviews.author: Laura Clifford

reviews.text: This is just a joyful, heartfelt, and blood-drenched comic book spectacle that does the Squad the utmost justice.
reviews.author: Jack Bottomley

reviews.text: [John Cena's] laughing at himself all the time and it works really well. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Alejandro G. Calvo

reviews.text: Instead of dwelling on trying to make his bad guys good, Gunn leans into their psychotic tendencies and mixes them all together to create a cocktail of crazy that will shock and delight audiences.
reviews.author: Rachael Harper

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad might be the kindest superhero film ever made. Sure, it's about criminals forced into life-threatening missions at the promise of freedom and the threat of death. But under all that ultra violence lies something far sweeter.
reviews.author: Rosie Knight

reviews.text: Not a single gag lands and most of them offend. This might actually be worse than the first one.
reviews.author: Lillian Crawford

reviews.text: A feast of blood we didn't think possible in nowadays superhero cinema. (...) It's funny, naughty, filled with action that doesn't erase its heart. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jesus Agudo

reviews.text: Gunn's cinematic paradise has enough visual dazzle for three regular movies; the equivalent of the kitchen sink being tossed at the wall... twice for good measure.
reviews.author: Dan Buffa

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is a lot of movie that can't always pull off its biggest, boldest ideas, but it's not the rehash its title implies.
reviews.author: Esther Zuckerman

reviews.text: Gunn honors and embraces the comic's silly essence and the social criticism. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Janire Zurbano

reviews.text: Only the man who wrote Tromeo and Juliet could deliver something this gleefully grotesque, vicious, and unapologetic, and the DC Universe is all the better for it.
reviews.author: Brian Tallerico

reviews.text: [A] ferociously funny, foul-mouthed and ultra-violent film...
reviews.author: Dulcie Pearce

reviews.text: Gunn breathes new life into the hit-or-miss DC franchise.
reviews.author: George Simpson

reviews.text: A gonzo mix of insouciant violence, demented comedy, expressionistic comic book flourishes and strangely beautiful cinematography...
reviews.author: Alistair Harkness

reviews.text: In many ways, the gleefully profane, anything-goes mayhem of The Suicide Squad feels like a mega-budget version of the Troma Studios productions that gave Gunn his start. And thank goodness for that.
reviews.author: Katie Rife

reviews.text: An epic that's as adorable as it is violent.
reviews.author: Charlotte O'Sullivan

reviews.text: [James Gunn] gets that this Squad has to remain unprincipled and, most importantly, really, very incredibly fun.
reviews.author: Peter Gray

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is probably the closest we'll get to a big-budget Troma film released by a major studio, and it's high time we treasured it, warts and all.
reviews.author: Clint Worthington

reviews.text: I can't think of anyone better than James Gunn to have served up this hilarious mayhem without letting the whole thing slide into nihilism or lose touch with actual emotion amid the body count.
reviews.author: Steve Newall

reviews.text: It truly feels like Gunn's career has come full circle on this film, and I loved how wonderfully unhinged The Suicide Squad is at times, where Gunn's enthusiasm for crafting bizarre cinematic experiences is fully on display from start to finish.
reviews.author: Heather Wixson

reviews.text: This is a movie where the US government hires a shark that talks like Sylvester Stallone to tear people in half, and it is sick. It is sick as hell.
reviews.author: Richard Trenholm

reviews.text: Fuses James Gunn's early career Troma sensibilities with the enormous misfit heart of Guardians of the Galaxy while giving Margot Robbie's Harley Quinn some of her best action and dialogue thus far
reviews.author: Robert Kojder

reviews.text: Gunn gels it together with a wicked sense of humour and an evident affection for his characters who, though not so endearing as his Guardians of the Galaxy, are a hoot to hang around with.
reviews.author: Dan Jolin

reviews.text: It lets writer-director James Gunn indulge his wildest impulses in a way Marvel would simply never allow and still manages to be very funny and emotionally satisfying,
reviews.author: Travis Johnson

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is a blast! Great action, lots of humor and fun twists with an awesome soundtrack. James Gunn does it again! [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jorge Rivera Rubio

reviews.text: "The Suicide Squad" is relentlessly unapologetic, wacky and weird, violent and bloody, and darkly humorous. It also has so much heart that you may find yourself fighting back tears by its end.
reviews.author: Kirsten Acuna

reviews.text: Gleefully wicked, fabulously demented, and gloriously gory--who knew villains could be this good.
reviews.author: Sherin Nicole

reviews.text: It is Mr. Gunn's voice here in every scene, in every blood-soaked encounter, every brilliantly placed song, and every moment of humor and heart it's because of James Gunn - as well as the incredible talent he brought with him.
reviews.author: JimmyO

reviews.text: Goofiness mixed in with lingering shots of maimed lasagne-like innards feels just plain wrong.
reviews.author: Christina Newland

reviews.text: Though there appears to be a ceiling to Gunn's familiar template, this is still a very enjoyable entry that ranks amongst the better examples of the DC Universe and miles ahead of most of them.
reviews.author: Erik Childress

reviews.text: Faint praise may be all the praise one can muster for The Suicide Squad but knowing the Suicide Squad that may be more than enough.
reviews.author: Fred Topel

reviews.text: A film considerably more entertaining than its predecessor, retaining the cold draught of bleakness that blows through the best of the DC Universe but with the visual brightness and romantic yearning that makes Gunn's work pop.
reviews.author: Leslie Felperin

reviews.text: From the eclectic soundtrack to the over-the-top violence and jet-black humor this is a movie only Gunn could deliver and it's easily the best of the DCEU.
reviews.author: Travis Hopson

reviews.text: This film is a wild ride full of intense action scenes, hilarious dialogue, and characters dripping in charisma. If chaotic good were a movie, it would be this one.
reviews.author: Joshua Mackey

reviews.text: Amazing!! Insanely violent, wide on it's level of scope, humor is at its Peak for DC, & it's so much fun! James has given us yet another one of the Best in Comicbook Films!
reviews.author: Samuel Leggett Jr.

reviews.text: Even more than the Guardians of the Galaxy pictures, Gunn's Suicide Squad overflows with characters and personalities.
reviews.author: Jesse Hassenger

reviews.text: [I]f you're an individual hooked into Gunn's wavelength, you're going to have a raucous good time.
reviews.author: Eric Eisenberg

reviews.text: Gunn's relentlessly entertaining film just doesn't stop moving.
reviews.author: James Mottram

reviews.text: The perfect length, the perfect cast, the perfect amount of action, comedy, and gore - and it all comes together to tell a heartwarming and emotional story. A masterpiece.
reviews.author: Tessa Smith

reviews.text: Now that's how you do it.
reviews.author: Ed Potton

reviews.text: James Gunn is unleashed, unhinged, and unstoppable in the most absurd and gory DC film to date!
reviews.author: EJ Moreno

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is the funniest DC film since Shazam.
reviews.author: Danielle Solzman

reviews.text: When Gunn took on Guardians Of The Galaxy, he turned nonsense into gold for Marvel. By giving The Suicide Squad the same sense of mischief and an equally surreal streak, he's done the same for DC.
reviews.author: Olly Richards

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad is a vast improvement. And in a world where a movie as bad as Suicide Squad (2016) exists? That's enough.
reviews.author: Alison Foreman

reviews.text: It's dazzlingly colourful and riotously crass, but also emotionally alive.
reviews.author: Robbie Collin

reviews.text: The whole of James Gunn's zany and violent 'The Suicide Squad' is less than the sum of its parts, but many of those parts are pretty damn great.
reviews.author: Scott Mendelson

reviews.text: Though deliciously violent, unapologetically haywire, and wildly uproarious, it's also brilliantly audacious, sharply intelligent and surprisingly heartfelt.
reviews.author: Courtney Howard

reviews.text: Gunn's distinct and self-assured vision, which he's said was left untouched and unbothered by studio interference, puts The Suicide Squad alongside the very best of modern comic-book filmmaking.
reviews.author: Clarisse Loughrey

reviews.text: That Warner Bros. would surrender one of their biggest franchises to this kind of filmmaking voice is a minor miracle.
reviews.author: David Crow

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad not only raises the bar for just how much a superhero movie can accomplish in one sitting, but it proves that the weird and oft-forgotten comic characters are superstars deserving of your attention.
reviews.author: Jenna Anderson

reviews.text: Whichever way you slice it, this Squad (aka Task Force X) is fun to hang out with.
reviews.author: Neil Smith

reviews.text: A good half of the jokes don't land, but unlike his predecessor's joyless slog, Gunn's version at least celebrates the nonsense...
reviews.author: Leah Greenblatt

reviews.text: Sometimes, you just need to watch a humanoid shark tear a man in half.
reviews.author: Barry Hertz

reviews.text: What emerges through the array of flying limbs is a surprisingly tender tribute to camaraderie, and an ode to all the despised and misunderstood creatures out there.
reviews.author: Mark Cassidy

reviews.text: Pitched somewhere between a reboot and a sequel, this is a violent, foul-mouthed and gleefully bonkers attempt to right the wrongs of David Ayer's Suicide Squad.
reviews.author: Andy Lea

reviews.text: Not everything works here, but the sheer crazy confidence-through-chaos of the Suicide Squad and their bizarrely dysfunctional MO makes for a mighty spectacle.
reviews.author: Peter Bradshaw

reviews.text: Mines incredible fun from being brutally unkind to its "heroes."
reviews.author: Jeffrey Zhang

reviews.text: Writer/director James Gunn achieves delirious multimedia fidelity with The Suicide Squad, his bombastic, silly and self-aware revisionist take on the super-group of screw-ups.
reviews.author: Jacob Oller

reviews.text: Embraces a superhero vibe (even chock-full of morally questionable rogues hoping the government doesn't blow their heads off) and adds elements of workplace comedy, gritty war movie, dysfunctional family drama and kaiju disaster flick.
reviews.author: Brian Truitt

reviews.text: '...a vast improvement on the famously soulless original...'
reviews.author: Eddie Harrison

reviews.text: If the movies are killing themselves with superhero overload, at least "The Suicide Squad" suggests the medium will go down laughing.
reviews.author: David Ehrlich

reviews.text: Within "The Suicide Squad" is not only a negotiation with American power, and its depiction in comic-book movies, but a heartfelt if extreme gallery of damaged souls. It's a kind of genuinely tender freak show.
reviews.author: Jake Coyle

reviews.text: After 2016's ugly, bludgeoning "Suicide Squad," I couldn't imagine liking - and could barely stomach the idea of seeing - another movie called "Suicide Squad." I'm delighted to be proven wrong.
reviews.author: Justin Chang

reviews.text: A really entertaining hard-R-rated take on the property that has just as much in common with '60s-era movies like The Dirty Dozen and Kelly's Heroes as it does with most of the DC canon.
reviews.author: Pete Hammond

reviews.text: It's exactly what we want from a blockbuster: a genuinely unique movie that's the product of a filmmaker, rather than a committee. And it also helps that The Suicide Squad is also just so entertaining as a result.
reviews.author: Ian Sandwell

reviews.text: James Gunn absolutely kills it with The Suicide Squad. The film is a bloody, chaotic ride from start to finish that finally does justice to Task Force X.
reviews.author: Joshua Yehl

reviews.text: Not only does it find the nastily enjoyable vibe that eluded its predecessor, but it also tells a story worth following...
reviews.author: John DeFore

reviews.text: Gunn has dialled the comic book movie up to 11 with The Suicide Squad, in one of the most unabashedly bonkers, action-packed & surprisingly emotional DC flicks
reviews.author: Nicola Austin

reviews.text: The Suicide Squad, from the mind of writer-director James Gunn, is both wickedly entertaining and shamelessly depraved fun set in the DC movie world.
reviews.author: Molly Freeman

reviews.text: "The Suicide Squad" is cunningly scuzzy, disreputable fun.
reviews.author: Owen Gleiberman

reviews.text: One of the franchise's biggest, bloodiest and most bizarre movies yet - and also one of its best.
reviews.author: Perri Nemiroff

reviews.text: The unexpected heart at the center of the film, a sneaky anti-imperialist bent, and Gunn's wild visual leaps make The Suicide Squad a bloody, gory delight.
reviews.author: Hoai-Tran Bui

reviews.text: Brilliant, bloody and brutal. James Gunn takes aim at the absurdities of the superhero genre and gives it both barrels.
reviews.author: Zehra Phelan

reviews.text: By no means perfect, but like the Deadpool movies, it's a showcase for what can happen when a superhero movie is allowed to be sprightly, self-aware, and sardonic while also indulging in hard-R violence, gore, and language.
reviews.author: Alonso Duralde

reviews.text: We finally get to see the R-rated DC Comics movie so many have been clamoring for.
reviews.author: Edward Douglas

reviews.text: The cast feels secure in their roles. Margot Robbie's Harley Quinn is in full bloom, and you can see that she's not only got hold of the character, but that the script gives her room to breathe.
reviews.author: Brian Lloyd

reviews.text: The edgy adventure that the first Squad was supposed to be.
reviews.author: Matt Singer

reviews.text: Fantastic! A no holds barred, superhero/comics bonanza. Unpredictable in story, unique in style and full of risks. Violent and hilarious. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Fico Cangiano

reviews.text: Both sides of James Gunn's personality are on display in "The Suicide Squad," a gnarly, irreverent, bloody, R-Rated comic book movie with a big empathetic heart.
reviews.author: Rodrigo Perez

synopsis: Welcome to hell--a.k.a. Belle Reve, the prison with the highest mortality rate in the US of A. Where the worst Super-Villains are kept and where they will do anything to get out--even join the super-secret, super-shady Task Force X. Today's do-or-die assignment? Assemble a collection of cons, including Bloodsport, Peacemaker, Captain Boomerang, Ratcatcher 2, Savant, King Shark, Blackguard, Javelin and everyone's favorite psycho, Harley Quinn. Then arm them heavily and drop them (literally) on the remote, enemy-infused island of Corto Maltese. Trekking through a jungle teeming with militant adversaries and guerrilla forces at every turn, the Squad is on a search-and-destroy mission with only Colonel Rick Flag on the ground to make them behave...and Amanda Waller's government techies in their ears, tracking their every movement. And as always, one wrong move and they're dead (whether at the hands of their opponents, a teammate, or Waller herself). If anyone's laying down bets, the smart money is against them--all of them.
